item.title: Complex System
item.description: What is a complex system? Just some thoughts: A single person can not understand a complex system. The same action may lead to different results.

item.title: Pure functions? Effects?
item.description: You already sold on the idea using and composing pure functions for “calculations” and pushing effects to the edge of your program. While you put a lot of effort in to internalize these ideas, some of your may never been co-workers exposed to these ideas. Leaving you with the task explaining it to them. You could either start talking about all these undeniable benefits or you could help your co-worker to build a mental model.

item.title: Ignoramus
item.description: In the book “Sapiens A Brief History of Humankind” Yuval Noah Harari describes that the scientific revolution happened because human were finally able to admit that ‘we do not know’. While this probably holds true in broader terms. We still have to try hard not falling into the trap not questioning our self, thinking “I know”. Especially when we worked on something for a while and we are quit proud of it.

item.title: Duality between data and code
item.description: The first sentence on the Wikipedia page about “Code as data”: In computer science, the expressions code as data and data as code refer to the duality between code and data, that allows computers to treat instructions in a programming language as data handled by a running program. [0] I strongly associate the phrase “data as code” with LISP and I absolutely do love to speak about LISP but this time I will try to explore the other way around: “code as data”.

item.title: Continuous Delivery for personal projects
item.description: If you are like me, you build side projects from time to time. Some of them are application running on a server. This led me to the question what is a lightweight and simple way to deploy those application. Do I need to setup a full CI/CD pipeline? These are often heavy tools to run production grade software. Maybe a simple script is good enough for my use-case? After all, I’m most likely to abandon this project after a while.
